DataElement.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary melanoma of the skin based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin. Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi. Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma._Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma
Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Clinical
Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/9/18 tt moved to NCI Standards Context. Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  The TNM clinical and pathologic regional lymph nodes tumor classifications of cutaneous melanoma are not the same. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma 1.01 to 2 mm in thickness, with or without ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT2 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma 1.01 to 2 mm in thickness, with or without ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma 1.01 to 2 mm in thickness, with no ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT2a TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma 1.01 to 2 mm in thickness, with no ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma 1.01 to 2 mm thick, with ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT2b TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma 1.01 to 2 mm thick, with ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma 2.01 to 4 mm thick, with or without ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT3 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma 2.01 to 4 mm thick, with or without ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma 2.01 to 4 mm in thickness, with no ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT3a TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma 2.01 to 4 mm in thickness, with no ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma 2.01 to 4 mm thick, with ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT3b TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma 2.01 to 4 mm thick, with ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, with or without ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT4 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, with or without ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, without ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT4a TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, without ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT4b TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pTis TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with a tumor measuring 1.0 mm or less in thickness, with ulceration or mitoses equal to or more than 1/mm2. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with a tumor measuring 1.0 mm or less in thickness, with ulceration or mitoses equal to or more than 1/mm2. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with a tumor measuring 1.0 mm or less in thickness, without ulceration and with mitosis less than 1/mm2. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with a tumor measuring 1.0 mm or less in thickness, without ulceration and with mitosis less than 1/mm2. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with a tumor measuring 1.0 mm or less in thickness. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with a tumor measuring 1.0 mm or less in thickness. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pT0 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pTX TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pTX TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed (e.g., curettaged or severely regressed melanoma). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pTX TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed (e.g., curettaged or severely regressed melanoma). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
